alert.note: Alert for Allen; Putnam (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 4:11PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Putnam, southeastern Henry and eastern Allen Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 410 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Glandorf to Columbus Grove to near Fort Shawnee. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Columbus Grove around 415 PM EDT. Glandorf around 420 PM EDT. Ottawa and Deshler around 425 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Leipsic, Bluffton, Pandora and Mcclure. This includes Interstate 75 between mile markers 123 and 141. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northwestern and west central Ohio.
